Trade is possible

There where some discussions about what we could do as our currency but I came up with the idea of making it trade only. Although this seems kinda insane an people predict that a currency will be invented anyway I decided to write down this draft to explain what I really mean.

The system

When you start the game I suggest you don't start empty handed ... Lets say that the starting player has the following at the start:

  • 2 apples
  • 1 half bread
  • 20 silver pieces
  • 1 piece of ham
  • clothes

That is not much for a start. One note about the 20 silver pieces ... They can be worth something but that depends on the current value of silver.

Basically it works like this ... the game system has a database full of items with there corresponding meshes (or name of the mesh). With these items the quantity is stored. According to the quantity in the world, the value will be determined for it. This value will be used as internal value (IV). This means that silver pieces can have a value of 10 IV (Internal value). Lets first outline the databases: 

*** Item database ***
id | name         | libraryname  | max_q | min_val | max_val | preferred
 1 | apples       | apple        |   500 |      20 |     120 |    50
 2 | half bread   | bread_half   |   300 |      10 |     100 |    20
 3 | bread        | bread        |   400 |      15 |     200 |    40
 4 | piece of ham | ham          |   500 |      25 |     500 |    80
 5 | small knife  | knife_A      |   200 |      40 |     800 |    90
 6 | start cloth  | cloth_a      |  9000 |      20 |      80 |    30
 7 | worker cloth | cloth_b      |   600 |      35 |     125 |    60
 8 | mage cloth   | cloth_c      |   500 |     200 |    1220 |   450
 9 | silver piece | silver_piece | 99999 |       2 |      20 |    10
10 | copper piece | copper_piece | 99999 |       1 |      10 |    5

The item DB is the static DB which will be used for the calculations. 

*** Value database ***
id | quantity | value
 1 |       80 |   93.25
 2 |       50 |   65.56
 3 |      385 |   12.19

Detirmining the value

In the "value database" the value is detirmined by a nice formula: 

Let:
p = preferred value
m = minimum value
n = maximum value
q = maximum quantity
x = quantity
V = value

V = (2 * (m + n - 2 * p) / q ^ 2) * x ^ 2 - (( m + 3 * n - 4 * p) / q) * x + n
This formula was derived by generalizing the equation of a quadratic function 
passing through the points (0, n), (q/2, p), and (q, m). It is the best way.

For a quantity of 80 apples, we get a value of 93.248 per apple.

If we plot Value vs. Quantity, we get the following curve: 

//TODO: Get image from old system

Notice how the curve bends towards the preferred value at (250, 50).

Demand

Going further, the preferred value could be determined by the demand for the item. Preferred value would be directly proportional to demand.

From this we obtain the following formula for p (preferred value): 

p = (# of trades / max_q) * (max_val - min_val) + min_val

The number of trades would be calculated by a continuous average of trades per unit time.
